---
title: R Lists
---

When it comes to finding information and resources on the R programming language, there are numerous websites that provide tutorials, documentation, community support, and more. Here is a curated list of the top sites:

1. **[The Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN)](https://cran.r-project.org/)** - The official repository for R packages and documentation.
16. **[R Project](https://www.r-project.org/)** - The official website for the R programming language.
9. **[The R Foundation](https://www.r-project.org/foundation/)** - The R Foundation is a not for profit organization working in the public interest, founded by the members of the R Development Core Team.
2. **[RStudio IDE](https://posit.co/products/open-source/rstudio//)** - Offers RStudio IDE, Shiny, RMarkdown, and many other tools and resources.
3. **[R-bloggers](https://www.r-bloggers.com/)** - A blog aggregator for R news and tutorials.
4. **[Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/r)** - A community-driven Q&A site where you can find answers to R-related questions.
6. **[Tidyverse](https://www.tidyverse.org/)** - A collection of R packages designed for data science.
7. **[GitHub](https://github.com/topics/r)** - A platform where you can find and share R projects and code.
8. **[Kaggle](https://www.kaggle.com/)** - Offers datasets, notebooks, and competitions that often involve R.
10. **[Coursera](https://www.coursera.org/)** - Offers online courses and specializations in R from various universities.
11. **[edX](https://www.edx.org/)** - Provides courses on R programming and data analysis from top institutions.
12. **[LinkedIn Learning](https://www.linkedin.com/learning/)** - Offers professional courses on R.
13. **[RStudio Community](https://community.rstudio.com/)** - A forum for R users to discuss topics and get help.
14. **[Reddit - R Language](https://www.reddit.com/r/rprogramming/)** - A subreddit for R-related discussions and questions.
17. **[R Weekly](https://rweekly.org/)** - A weekly newsletter with the latest R news and tutorials.
18. **[Awesome R](https://awesome-r.com/)** - A curated list of R packages and resources.
19. **[R4DS (R for Data Science)](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/)** - An online version of the popular "R for Data Science" book.
20. **[posit Cheatsheets](https://posit.co/resources/cheatsheets/)** - A collection of useful R cheatsheets.

These sites provide a wide range of resources, from introductory tutorials to advanced techniques, making them invaluable for both beginners and experienced R programmers.
